etymologies: mid 19th century: from hexa- ‘six’ + Greek gramma ‘line’

definitions: a star-shaped figure formed by two intersecting equilateral triangles.
shortDefinitions: star-shaped figure formed by two intersecting equilateral triangles

definitions: any of a set of sixty-four figures made up of six parallel whole or broken lines, occurring in the ancient Chinese I Ching.
shortDefinitions: any of set of sixty-four figures made up of six parallel whole or broken lines
